title: Disappointing Durability: My Experience with the Everlane Felted Merino Half-Zip Sweater
text: I purchased the Everlane Felted Merino Half-Zip Sweater on November 30th, 2024, during a sale for ‚Ç¨116 (approximately $131.76). The original price at the time was ‚Ç¨194. While the initial feel of the 100% merino wool was pleasant and completely itch-free, and the fit was excellent, the quality has been significantly disappointing, especially considering the price point, even with the discount. Despite wearing the sweater only 2-3 days a week for roughly 4-6 hours at a time and being careful to avoid any activities that could damage the fabric (such as physical exertion or gardening), noticeable pilling began to appear around mid-December. I took extra precautions to minimize friction against other clothing, yet the entire body of the sweater is now extensively covered in pills. Based on this first experience with Everlane, I cannot personally recommend this brand. For anyone considering purchasing this sweater or other Everlane items, I strongly advise you to reconsider and conduct thorough research beforehand. This experience has highlighted a significant issue with the durability of this particular garment and may save you from a similar disappointment. --- EDIT --- Following this review, Everlane's customer support promptly contacted me to address my concerns. I appreciate their willingness to take responsibility and provide a satisfactory resolution in this manner. They discontinued a fave pair of mine so I have been trying to find an alternative on the website and ordered quite a few pairs in one order as being in the UK it‚Äôs not a quick delivery so did a huge order hoping I would find some good ones . However the order didn‚Äôt arrive and so customer service kindly sent a replacement as I was going on holiday and really wanted to take some with me. The original order finally came (late) but the replacement order never did (tracking states it‚Äôs still waiting to be picked up from dhl one month ago). I tried to not let that phase me and had to reorder some pieces as the sizing isn‚Äôt consistent to my other everlane jeans which I find strange. However these haven‚Äôt arrived either. It‚Äôs been 15 days and although tracking states it‚Äôs cleared customs one week ago there isn‚Äôt any further tracking. Delivery times stated on website say 4-10 days to the UK. I reached out to customer service and I have been told I need to leave it another 2-3 weeks before they can deem this order lost and send me a replacement. In which time the sizes may be out of stock and I then have to wait another couple of weeks to receive it. I don‚Äôt understand why Everlane can‚Äôt reach out to their shipping companies and find out why parcels are consistently getting lost. Surely lost orders costs the company money not to mention upsetting their international customers and reputation. Everlane please sort this out. Reading the reviews i can see I‚Äôm not alone. Also one of the pairs I wanted to keep were faulty, I have been told a replacement is on its way but will that one arrive? Seriously not happy here Everlane.

title: Customer Service
text: I placed an order last week and never received a confirmation email despite my credit card being charged for the items. I chatted with a rep who stated they would immediately send one. text: I am surprised by the negative reviews as I have had the most fabulous customer service. Perhaps the company have taken into consideration the complaints. I could not be happier with the speed in which my enquiry was dealt with and how they rectified the issue. I will 100% shop again. Thank you!! title: Beautiful clothes, bad experience
text: The delivery time was fine, but the parcel arrived damaged and there was no notification of the pending delivery. It was simply left outside the door. If I didn't live in the country, it would have been gone. Unfortunately, the size information on the site is completely wrong. I know my exact measurements and ordered everything according to them. Very annoying as I now have to pay 12!!! ‚Ç¨ for the return shipment because of incorrect sizing. If I had also known in advance that the return shipment can ONLY be made with DPD, I would not have ordered, as I now have to drive another 20km to the nearest collection point. All in all, one of the worst experiences I've ever had in online shopping and absolutely not recommended! The 2 stars are for the delivery time of less than 10 working days and the clothes, which are really beautiful. However, I have had much better experiences with other brands.

title: Odd policies for exchange
text: Strangely they wouldn't allow me to exchange on a final sale item for the same product, just a size smaller which they had in stock online. title: Order failed and super delayed refund
text: I made an order on 12 June. This did not go well and now I can expect refund in August?! - I order and not told the coat will not arrive. title: International Everlane Shoppers - Prepare to be Patient
text: I'm an international shopper from the UK to Everlane. I really like their clothes, which comparatively, are much better quality to a lot of competing brands in the same price range. You do have to be patient when you order from outside the US - as there seems to be a glitch with their fulfillment providers (DHL and another provider) who generate an arrival date that in my experience is a few days BEFORE the parcel actually arrives. You then assume that your parcel is lost forever, searching around to see if it may have been dumped somewhere secret, when no, it's still making it's way to you. Everlane - please fix this glitch! I'm happy to wait if the tracking is accurate - which it hasn't been for two orders now. I believe this is more a DHL problem, (as it happened with another brand's order as well), but perhaps you can lean on them to fix it. Overall - I love the clothes, but the tracking of orders should be improved. (One star off for the shipping issues).

title: Two awful experiences with Everlane
text: I've placed two orders with Everlane from the UK. The first one took about three weeks to arrive. I had to contact them to get updates and share feedback but eventually the order came and the quality of the clothes was decent but I wouldn't pay full price for the items. I saw there was a sale on May 26th so I placed an order . On May 31st I received an email that the order had "shipped" but on June 4th the order was in the same status and detailed tracking showed that only the shipping label had been created. I contacted Everlane and the rep tried to tell me that it was in transit but there's an error with DHL tracking and that she couldn't do anything but if I didn't receive the order by the 21st of June to reach out. I told her that wasn't acceptable and she gave me another excuse about extended international shipping times to some regions - the parcel is traveling from Ohio to central London. I check back yesterday and suddenly the tracking has been updated and to my surprise DHL had just received the parcel. Estimated arrival date is 12 June. I strongly recommend against buying from Everlane in the UK - it's a headache and they lie to your face. It's clear if you read other reviews many have had the same experience.

title: Everlane
text: I ordered a linen shirt because their store did not have my size. I was told that the express order would arrive in 3 days. Days later, I did not see any delivery but received an email that my package arrived. I went on their terribly designed website that states that sometimes shippers show the item was received but may still be in transit. Their initial reply to me was to check a long list of possible shippers they use???? A few days later I again emailed the company to let them know I did not receive the item. It took multiple emails to learn that the shipper was DHL. They insisted that the item was delivered and I requested proof of delivery, because it may have been delivered to a neighbor. They suggested that I check around the neighborhood. I said a proof of the delivery would be better. Finally, I requested a refund which was provided 9 days after my order. 13 days after the order, the package was delivered. I told them they can resell this shirt to me for a discount of 40%. This discount I requested was because while I was waiting for the shirt to arrive, it went on sale for 25% off, plus my first order discount of 15% should also be honored. They said no, and provided a shipping label. I feel that they provided an ignorant solution. I wasted close to two weeks over this shipment and then had to drive 30 minutes to send it back by UPS. I will never buy from this company again.

title: Slightly faffy returns process but otherwise good
text: The clothes are actually really nice and decent quality (although not equal to the prices charged). However, the reason for not giving 5 stars is that the returns process was a bit faffy. title: Shop here if you want to be disappointed and mugged off
text: Horrible, never again. Firstly, shipping costs are so expensive as if I was ordering from Saturn. Crazy. title: Low quality material

title: All perfectly fine.

title: Avoid
text: I emailed to ask about a price adjustment, to avoid sending back the coat and reshipping the same item at cost to the company, Response from customer service was that I had ordered too early to receive a price adjustment. Now I will ship my item back (even with shipping costs still a big saving) and reorder the same item, which is eligible for free shipping. Seems insane for a 'sustainable' company, but that's the only response I can get from customer service.

title: Consistently good quality and logistics.
text: I've made several orders to Everlane over the years, mostly for cashmere or alpaca knitwear. Their product has been consistently high quality, and you can't beat their shipping prices. They lose one star for discontinuing some of their staples, like the cashmere turtleneck sweater, which really should just be perennial like the equivalent crewneck, and for the "soft wool Italian" sweater, which did not stand up to a hand wash without severe shrinking. Overall, if you avoid the "Soft Italian Wool" products (which seem to not be available anymore anyway), they seem to have nailed alpaca and cashmere knitwear, some of which I bought a while ago. They've been worn and washed regularly, and they've all held up well.

title: Slow shipping and online return is a hassle
text: Update: Rachel from customer care reached out to me and was very helpful. It did change my experience for the better and Everlane are lucky to have her. I still don't think I will use Everlane.com again, but it might work for others. title: I love Everlane, as do many of my working friends.
text: I am a repeat customer at Everlane because they straddle the balance between fast fashion and luxury. Their clothing is cut well and usually has nice details. It is not cheap because it is well made and built to last. I was VERY surprised to see they had such a low rating. One of the other reasons I never hesitate to shop with Everlane is that although I live in Canada, they have made it easy and efficient to do returns. I was surprised to see they have such a low rating. It is far more difficult for me to return Amazon purchases! Once a box is delivered (always quickly) if there is an item I wish to return, I bring up my order online and press ‚ÄòStart Return‚Äô, my full order is presented and I tick the box next to whatever I wish to return (only some deeply discounted items are final purchase but they are clearly marked in red) Ôøº Once my items are chosen to return, I am immediately issued a label to print. Part goes inside the box, part is the exterior label and I wrap it up and take my parcel to the local Post Office who issue a receipt. That is all there is to it. I have always been refunded in a timely manner. I find the quality, for the price, to be exceptionally good at Everlane. Once I figured out my size which took a little bit of back and forth, it has become very easy for me to now know exactly what will fit me well etc.. The only thing that makes sense to me is that perhaps they used to be difficult to deal with but have, in 2023, improved greatly. I can think of no other retailer, that does not have a brick & mortar store, that is as easy to purchase and return to. As well, there are not that many brands that are still affordable and produce good quality cottons that we Gen X grew up with and took for granted. These are decent basics that you can own forever once you get your fit right.

title: Awful Quality and Service
text: Awful quality. Awful customer service. Product was of terrible quality - cheap material poorly constructed. title: Wrong item delivered but dealt with efficiently and refunded.
text: Incorrect item disguised as correct item delivered. I ordered a pair of Everlane Super Soft Relaxed Jeans in light vintage blue. What arrived was a pair of high rise skinny jeans in dark blue. What was even more bizarre was that the labelling, belonging to the Super Soft Relaxed Jeans, had clearly been ripped from the Super Soft Relaxed Jeans, and stuffed in the back pocket of the high rise skinnies to make it look as if these were the correct jeans. Everlane did very quickly and efficiently sort the issue out, giving me a full refund and allowing me to keep the jeans. I don't know what had gone wrong on the supply end, but it was dealt with and managed. 3 stars- 1 star for the wrong item and the strange label which looked as if it had been ripped from another pair of jeans, and 2 stars for the management of the issue. Will order from Everlane again - hopefully this is a one off.

I'm no lawyer but excluding liability is illegal in Australia, especially when the website seems to cater for Australian customers. I absolutely do not recommend Everlane for Australians out there.

title: Ok experience as an Australian shopper
text: Writing a review as an Australian online shopper, in case it helps anyone. Tips: make the most of the free shipping for your first order. Pay using PayPal so that you can be reimbursed for return shipping costs. There's a big difference between express and standard shipping. I qualified for free express shipping for my first order and it's amazing. My order was packed next business day and they shipped using DHL Express. Parcel loaded onto a plane over the weekend, and was delivered all up within 4 days. Faster than even domestic shipping via Australia Post. I qualified for free standard shipping for my second order. It took about 2.5 weeks to arrive. They took about 2-3 days to pack. It was shipped using DHL eCommerce and tracking shows that it goes to distribution centres, bundled into a container probably with numerous other orders, and then shipped using Australia Post for the last leg. So if you need your items soon, best to use express shipping. Returns are easy. You pay for and print the return label at home. It's sent to an APG warehouse in AU and only costs $12 (activate PayPal free return shipping before you order so that you can be reimbursed). Once it reaches APG, there doesn't seem to be a way to track further progress. So I have no idea when it will reach Everlane. Their website says even once they receive it, it takes 2-3 weeks for the refund to be processed. They sent an incorrect item for one of my orders. Website instructions say email customer service with photos. After a week, still no response. Will update this review when this gets finally resolved. EDIT: 3 weeks after I sent the email, all I got back was an automated email apologising them being overwhelmed with emails. Had to send back incorrect item at my own cost. With the garment measurements on the website and ability to search reviews of other people with same body measurements, you are likely to get the correct size. I ordered jeans, which are always a gamble. The material may be different to expectations. The quality seems good for the price, if you get items on sale. Otherwise seems a little expensive (maybe due to exchange rate).

title: We owe thoughtful brands our patience during these times
text: I've ordered from Everlane roughly 5 separate times, and I have never been disappointed with what I received. Anything that didn't quite fit the bill was returned without issue. I think it's important to highlight during this time, that all businesses are struggling with both shipping delays, changes in staffing, and cash flow in general. Even Nordstrom which is hailed as the queen of customer service, took over a month to process a return which resulted in a late fee on my card with them because they just didn't process it correctly. Frank and Oak, a long time favorite of mine, struggled to return a refund for about 5 weeks. These are unprecedented times, and what most people don't know, is that the biggest brands -- old navy, gap, kohl's, etc have the largest cash flows and more resiliency because they are so large and hoard cash. Smaller brands release cash flows more quickly into the economy which is exactly what we need right now. The retail environment is changing, and if we don't put our trust in these brands, we'll all be walking around with fast fashion as our only choice. Be thoughtful about spending money on things you know you'll love, and if something doesn't fit or feel right, return it on a credit (an option Everlane has immediately, before shipping the return even) towards something you do love.

I should have returned the Cheeky Straight Jeans the first time I bought them, because they had the odd defect, where the pocket lining showied unless the jeans were just-washed-tight. But I liked the jeans otherwise and wore them, and was assured in email the new version of those jeans did not have that problem. When the new version came in mid-April 2020, they had another odd problem, horizontal striations on the thighs that made the jeans look like they didn't fit, even when they weren't being worn! I contacted customer service and got no response. (It's now been more than two weeks.) So I'm trying to return the item and I'm finding their Returns site awful and impossible! I've tried in two browsers, in case one was the problem. The Confirm is now frozen stuck, won't go forward or back. Whether or not this problem resolves, I doubt I will ever use Everlane again. This is a crazy time, and none of us needs extra problems.

title: I just have to write a review here
text: I just have to write a review here, because I read some of the reviews below and maybe this reviews will set some people at ease regarding being scammed or whatever. Being a business owner myself, I completely get the high volume during a time where many Americans just got a pretty nice Stimulus check on top of stores being limited to online shopping. Of course business will be unusually busy and I think we should really take that into consideration when we're doing online shopping right now. I had a good experience with Everlane and I'm a first time customer. I placed an order a week ago and I just got it today in really nice packaging. I was a little wary, because I hadn't heard anything had shipped yet so I contacted their customer care center. They were quick to respond to my email, but not before I realized I had set up an Everlane account during the checkout process. There I saw it was on it's way (that was yesterday) and perfectly on time for my mother's birthday (today) -- she loved her gifts. The shirts fit and feel great. I am so glad they offer plain t-shirts with quality fabric that aren't the dreadful 'scoop neck', which unless you have a slender and petite body, is a terribly clumsy and unsophisticated look. Yes, even a t-shirt can create a sharp and sophisticated look if designed and worn right. I am definitely going to be filling my own wardrobe with Everlane clothing from here on. I am absolutely pleased by my entire experience! Thank you!

text: I have purchased several items from Everlane and have been generally happy. I also know how difficult and stressful COVID-19 has been on everyone. So why 2 stars? Instead, they want me to return the merchandise right after I receive it. Thus, instead of zero shipments, they are causing two shipments with the same outcome. Shame on you Everlane.

title: High hopes, but such poor quality
text: I chose to shop at Everlane because I worried about my fast fashion purchases and the imprint they were having on the environment. I recently purchased the "Boss Mules" because I thought they looked timeless and I was convinced they would last for years. I work in an office setting and these were a practical staple piece to add to my wardrobe. My first disappointment came when I scuffed the toe of one shoe. I assumed that like my husbands well made expensive shoes I would be able to polish it away. I was so upset to see that these were not repairable, the material chosen was not polish-able, it was just a leather overlay? I kept wearing them, intent on not buying new items and keeping my environmental footprint low. Until today, when on my way to a very important work meeting to my shock and horror the heel on my "Boss Mule" separated from the sole. After only 5 months of very light use they are completely destroyed. I looked completely disheveled, talk about a poor first impression. For a company who prides themselves on ethics this just feels wrong. It's upsetting that people trying so hard to do their part to contribute to society in a positive way are met with products that are misrepresented on sleek websites. I will hobble home today in not only embarrassment but the utmost disappointment in discovering yet another fast fashion company.

title: Mediocre, at best‚Ä¶
text: Everlane‚Äôs business model is what had me intrigued to purchase from the brand. I love the idea of being able to see just how much markup they place on their products and being able to choose what you pay for certain items. That being said, I don‚Äôt see myself purchasing from them in the future. I live in Australia and I had to split my purchase into two transactions because my order exceeded the ‚Äúfinancial limit‚Äù. I‚Äôve never heard of this before when ordering from the US and I honestly think it‚Äôs just a way for Everlane to cheap out on delivery insurance. My two orders combined came to just over $1000AUD. I (stupidly) assumed that because I had spent such a considerable amount for only five items that the quality would be exceptional. I was wrong - the items I received are of pretty mediocre quality. I ordered two of the ‚ÄúClean Silk Relaxed Shirt‚Äù thinking they would make excellent work wardrobe staples. Sizing is true, possibly even slightly generous. The shirts were constructed well, I‚Äôll give them that, however the silk was very sheer and not at all suitable to be worn on its own. At $98USD per shirt, I was expecting very luxurious fabric and sadly this silk just did not perform how I wanted it to. Back into the box to be returned! Next thing I purchased was the ‚ÄúBack-Slit Work Pant‚Äù. The material used for these glorified leggings is super stretchy but also quite durable; very comparable to a stretchy denim. I had one of my friends comment that they were very slimming. As I said though, they are vehemently not pants! They are leggings! They have no pockets (atrocious!), no lining, the elastic waistband is only tacked down on the top edge so occasionally it will roll up/down and become quite uncomfortable. For $50USD should have returned these too, but I liked the design so I have kept these. Sizing is true, and the leg length is nice and long and hits at my ankle (I‚Äôm 5‚Äô11‚Äù). Third item I purchased was the ‚ÄúClean Silk Charmeuse Tie Neck Blouse‚Äù. This pretty little blouse will set you back $98USD, but unlike the relaxed shirts this one isn‚Äôt sheer at all! It is very beautiful on and I love the design - very flattering. On the model it looked to be a nice length, but on me it does look like it‚Äôs slightly cropped. I would say that to pay $60USD for this item would be reasonable. I kept this item. In my next order I purchased two pairs of shoes; the ‚ÄúEditor heel‚Äù for $165USD and the ‚ÄúEditor slingback‚Äù for $155USD. I absolutely LOVE the look of these shoes and would have been quite happy with the quality (don‚Äôt get me wrong, there‚Äôs definitely room for improvement) but sadly the fit is not true to size as it suggests on Everlane‚Äôs website. I found both pairs of shoes to be very narrow. I would have liked to exchange these for the next size up, but sadly Everlane do not manufacture shoes larger than an 11. Back into the box to be returned! The returns process seems quite straightforward if you‚Äôre just returning one package. They have a flat-rate shipping price of $12.95AUD with Australia Post which is fine. I emailed customer service to ask if I could return all of my unwanted items in just one box, and sadly I can‚Äôt. I will be paying two separate shipping fees for two boxes to be shipped to the same place - ridiculous. They seem very inflexible regarding this matter. Why can‚Äôt customer service create a return label that incorporates both of my orders for any reason other than sheer laziness? Knowing that the quality is not deserving of the high price they place on their items, returns are not free, and that customer service really don‚Äôt serve their customers, I will not purchase nor recommend Everlane again.

title: Hit or miss clothes with outstanding customer service
text: I have purchased many items from everlane over the past few years. The quality is general very good for the price although the fit is very hit or miss. I've probably kept about a third or half of what I have ordered. I have also some issues with their shipping/fulfillment services lately, they sent the wrong jeans three times in a row. However what really stands out is their customer service. Every time I have had an issue with an order or an article of clothing (like a sweater that got a hole at a seam within a day of wear) they have given me the benefit of the doubt and resolved the issue quickly and considerately. This more than anything else is what keeps me coming back to the store. I don't mind taking a chance on individual items because I have confidence that returning them will be straightforward and easy. The only caveat to this is that I have noticed that their denim return policy has gotten stricter recently and their denim fit/comfort is all over the place so I would avoid jeans. I also wish they would be more size inclusive. Instead of coming out with so many new items all the time I wish they would focus on making larger sizes of their existing items or improving the fit and quality of those items.

title: Everlane does not respond when informed of fraudulent purchases
